headerDisplay: homebridge-blinds-cmd creates window covering (or blind) accessories in HomeKit, providing control and status functions through the command line scripts.
footerDisplay: For additional help and documentation please see the [developer page](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-blinds-cmd).

name.title: Blind Name
name.description: Name you want to give this blind accessory in HomeKit. Default: none.

up.title: Up Command Script
up.description: Path to the command or script to raise the blind. Default: none.

down.title: Down Command Script
down.description: Path to the command or script to lower the blind. Default: none.

stop.title: Stop Command Script
stop.description: Path to the command or script to stop the blind. Default: none.

status.title: Status Command Script
status.description: Path to the command or script to show the current position of the blind. Default: none.

transitionInterval.title: Simulated Transition Duration
transitionInterval.description: Duration, in seconds, of an open or close event used to simulate action progress in HomeKit. Default: 0 (disabled).

refreshRate.title: Status Refresh Interval
refreshRate.description: Interval, in seconds, to execute the status command or script in order to keep HomeKit up to date on blinds status. Default: 0 (disabled).

manufacturer.title: Blind Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: Manufacturer name to assign to this blind.

model.title: Blind Model
model.description: Model name to assign to this blind.

layout.description: Provide the details of your blinds.

items.description: These settings are optional and provide additional customization settings.
These settings are optional and allow you to set additional information about your blinds.
